subject: Self Care
title: Growth Mindset and Joy
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Growth Mindset and Joy.

hook.text: Two students failed the same test. One said 'I'm stupid.' The other said 'I haven't learned this yet.' Different futures.

buildup.text: Carol Dweck's growth mindset holds that abilities develop through effort. Fixed mindset holds they're innate and unchangeable.

discovery.text: Growth-mindset people embrace challenges, persist through setbacks, and learn from criticism. They find more joy in the process.

twist.text: The word 'yet' is transformative. 'I can't do this' is fixed. 'I can't do this yet' is growth. Three letters change everything.

climax.text: Catch yourself in fixed-mindset language this week. Replace 'I can't' with 'I can't yet.' Watch how your view of failure shifts.

punchline.text: Add 'yet' to every limitation. Growth mindset turns failure into fuel.

quiz.question: What is the key difference between fixed and growth mindset?
options: Growth mindset believes abilities develop through effort; fixed sees them as innate
There is no real difference between them
